headline.main: In Effort to Build Support, Obama Details Stimulus Plan
headline.print_headline: Obama, in Effort to Build Support, Lays Out Details of $825 Billion Stimulus Plan

docs.lead_paragraph: Releasing new details of an $825 billion economic recovery plan, President Obama depicted the proposal as critical to rebuilding for a new era.

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal aid to states will save essential programs, as well as keep states from rushing into short-term fixes that could have bad long-term consequences.

docs.lead_paragraph: As part of his pledge to use government to do what individuals cannot do for themselves, Barack Obama must include foreclosure relief in his economic recovery package.

docs.abstract: The Obama administration is working on a proposal to lower the top business tax rate by eliminating some loopholes, a plan that could be a wild card in the broader economic conversation.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is preparing to inject an unpredictable new variable into its economic policy clash with Republicans: a plan to overhaul corporate taxes.

headline.main: Texas, 12 Other States Sue to Block Obama Coal Mining Rule
headline.print_headline: Texas, 12 Other States Sue to Block Obama Coal Mining Rule

docs.lead_paragraph: Texas and 12 other states have asked a federal court to block final rules from President Barack Obama's administration designed to reduce coal mining's impact on streams.

headline.main: A Leader in the Senate Sees Sunny Skies for Democrats

byline.contributor: A previous version of this article did not note that Robert Menendez was incorrect in saying that  President Obama had won Missouri during the general election.

headline.main: Obama Pardons Retired U.S. General Convicted of Lying in 'Stuxnet' Leak Case
headline.print_headline: Obama Pardons Retired U.S. General Convicted of Lying in 'Stuxnet' Leak Case

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama on Tuesday pardoned a retired U.S. Marine Corps general who pleaded guilty in October to making false statements to the FBI during an investigation into leaks of classified information.

headline.main: The President Quits His Cigarette Habit

docs.abstract: The first lady tells reporters, over a lunch of winter greens salad and pan-roasted rockfish, that the president has not had a cigarette in almost a year.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama has quit smoking and has not had a cigarette in almost a year, his wife, Michelle Obama, said Tuesday.
